headline.main: U.S. Ties Secondhand Smoke to Cancer

docs.lead_paragraph: Secondhand tobacco smoke causes lung cancer that kills an estimated 3,000 nonsmokers a year and subjects hundreds of thousands of children to respiratory disease, the Environmental Protection Agency said today in a long-anticipated report. The E.P.A. study, issued after four years and several revisions, should serve as a rallying point for government and private efforts to reduce exposure to environmental tobacco smoke, Federal health officials said.
